intro: Synandrina, commonly known as the sacred lotus, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Nymphaeaceae. It is characterized by its showy, floating flowers that open during the day and close at night. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves that provide habitat for various aquatic organisms. Synandrina species are native to tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Asia and Africa. Its botanical features make it an important plant in both ecological and cultural contexts.
